definition: variant of 毀|毁[hui3]/to destroy by fire/a blaze
to destroy/to damage/to ruin/to defame/to slander
variant of 毀|毁[hui3]/to defame/to slander

sentences.english: The bayonet squad made a surprise attack and wiped out the enemy's command post.
sentences.chinese: 尖刀班出奇制胜，捣毁了敌人指挥部。

sentences.english: The newest version of the outrageously fun, smash-hit board game, Cranium?
sentences.chinese: 粗暴乐趣的新版本，捣毁击中了棋，头盖骨？

sentences.english: In retaliation, Israeli authorities demolished the family’s home in Gaza.
sentences.chinese: 为了报复，以色列当局捣毁了他位于加沙的家。

sentences.english: And destroy enemy command center if nece ary .
sentences.chinese: 如有必要捣毁敌指挥中心。

sentences.english: The naughty boy was chased by the bees because he destroyed the honeycomb.
sentences.chinese: 这个淘气的男孩因为捣毁了蜂房而被蜜蜂追赶。

sentences.english: Some coal mines had to shut down.
sentences.chinese: 我要捣毁内普丘恩煤矿。

sentences.english: Human rights groups say they will appeal the demolition orders.
sentences.chinese: 人权团体表示，他们将就捣毁令提出上诉。

sentences.english: You may be able to destroy an entire colony of roaches through this method.
sentences.chinese: 你可以通过这个方法一举捣毁整个小强老巢。

sentences.english: Shenze Public Security Bureau has successfully destroyed a city of gambling dens.
sentences.chinese: 深泽县公安局城区分局日前成功捣毁一赌博窝点。

sentences.english: But her endless chatter destroys the connection.
sentences.chinese: 但她无尽噜噜捣毁联系。

definition: to uncover (a criminal plot)/to break open and capture
to track down and seize (a criminal suspect, contraband etc)
to cover up/to conceal/to go into hiding
to recover (illegally obtained property)/to seize/to capture/to force sb to hand over sth/to levy
(of a bird, fish etc) to be caught in a net/(of a tennis ball) to hit the net/(of a criminal) to be captured
